arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney takes aim at 'naive' Plymouth players as ex-Man Utd team-mate has last laugh
arts.sum: Wayne Rooney saw his Plymouth side lead three times against Middlesbrough before eventually drawing a six-goal thriller, which saw the Pilgrims slip to the bottom of the Championship

arts.ttl: Carrick's Boro peg Rooney's Plymouth back three times in draw
arts.sum: Wayne Rooney's Plymouth led three times but will sit bottom of the table over Christmas after having to settle for a 3-3 draw with Michael Carrick's high-flying Middlesbrough in a Championship thriller at Home Park.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney sees Plymouth prop up table after dramatic Middlesbrough draw
arts.sum: Plymouth sit equal on 18 points with Cardiff and Oxford, but have an inferior goal difference.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough come from behind three times to draw at Plymouth with two sides to their performance
arts.sum: They won’t want to see their side’s defending again, but were at least treated to a spectacle as Jonny Howson, Hayden Hackney and Emmanuel Latte Lath fired the three Boro equalises to earn a point. Middlesbrough came from behind three times to draw 3-3 with Plymouth Argyle on a day where their defending left a lot to be desired, but their determination to take something from the game was at least rewarded.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney's verdict on Middlesbrough and the player his Plymouth side must 'nullify'
arts.sum: They have scored a lot of goals this season but we know we are in for a tough game and we have to be at our best to win. Azaz initially took some time to settle on Teesside after his switch, but he has taken his game to another level this season.

arts.ttl: Friendships to one side as Middlesbrough boss Michael Carrick takes on ex-team-mate Wayne Rooney
arts.sum: Looking for a victory which would guarantee Boro spend Christmas in the Championship top six, it's business for usual for Carrick despite the obvious strange feeling of trying to get one over his friend and yet more pressure to the fellow Manchester United legend, whose Plymouth side are without a win in six games heading into this one. With the novelty of it therefore out the way, Carrick is merely looking forward to seeing Rooney - though he admits they see as much of each other now as they did when Old Trafford team-mates due to their sons Kai and Jacey being part of the same Manchester United youth team.

arts.ttl: Three pundits agree on Plymouth Argyle vs Middlesbrough outcome as promotion race hots up
arts.sum: Middlesbrough can guarantee themselves a spot in the Championship play-off places at Christmas if they beat Plymouth Argyle on Saturday. Plymouth might be 23rd in the Championship and without a win in, but they've also lost just two of their nine games at Home Park this season.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney makes immediate Plymouth change in desperate bid to halt wretched run of form
arts.sum: Plymouth Argyle manager Wayne Rooney has made some changes as he looks to arrest his side's poor run of form that has left them second-bottom in the Championship

arts.ttl: Dael Fry opens up on Middlesbrough's promotion bid, his injury lay-off and Plymouth Argyle
arts.sum: For Fry, competition in his centre-back position epitomises that strength in depth that the 27-year-old believes is key to lasting the pace of the long Championship campaign as Michael Carrick aims to finally end Boro’s eight-year wait for top-flight football. Four of us have played a lot of Championship football then Rav is a young lad but he plays beyond his years.

arts.ttl: Former boss Chris Wilder has already told Middlesbrough what to expect against Plymouth Argyle
arts.sum: But Plymouth put up a good fight against the league’s table-toppers, with former Boro boss Wilder praising their approach and saying his side’s difficulties in the game epitomised the Championship and it’s cliched ‘anyone beat anyone’ tag. "We have got to give credit to Wayne and his coaching staff because they were the better side first half, without a shadow of a doubt.
